item.title: How to Unlock All Costumes in Ninja Gaiden 2 Black
item.description:
Like most modern action games, Ninja Gaiden 2 Black features a wide range of costumes for players to choose from. Players who spent time with the original game will know that the methods for unlocking these additional outfits are slightly different than might be expected. While many games would make these items collectibles in the main game, Ninja Gaiden 2 Black requires you to participate in alternative game modes. In this guide, we'll show you how to unlock every additional costume in NInja Gaiden 2 Black.

All Costumes in Ninja Gaiden 2 Black (& How to Get Them)

Additional Costumes for Ryu:

In Ninja Gaiden 2 Black, you can unlock three additional costumes for Ryu Hayabusa. Aside from the Legendary Black Falcon costume, which is unlocked by default, the new costumes are as follows:

  • Ninja Gaiden – Complete the game on any difficulty (Hero Mode does not count, it must be Path of the Acolyte, Warrior, Mentor, & Master Ninja.)
  • Dragon Muscles – Complete 10 Tag Missions (Tag missions are found on the main menu, and can be accessed from the start of the game.)
  • Fiend Hayabusa – Complete the game on Master Ninja Difficulty.

Completing the game on Master Ninja difficulty will unlock both the Fiend Hayabusa and Ninja Gaiden costumes. It will also unlock all difficulty-related costumes for the additional playable characters.

Additional Character Costumes:

Aside from Ryu, you can unlock additional costumes for Rachel, Ayane , and Momiji . These costumes are as follows:

  • Monk Robes – Momiji – Complete the game on Path of the Mentor difficulty. You must start a new game at this difficulty level. You cannot use Chapter Challenges.
  • Indigo-Dyed Happi – Momiji – Achieve the Master Ninja rank in 5 Chapter Challenges.
  • Business Suit – Rachel – Complete the game on Path of the Mentor difficulty.
  • Demon's Vacation – Rachel – Achieve the Master Ninja rank in 10 Chapter Challenges.
  • Ninja Gaiden Sigma – Ayane – Complete the game on Path of the Mentor difficulty.
  • Dead or Alive 5 – Complete 20 Tag Missions

How to Change Outfits in Ninja Gaiden 2 Black

Once you've unlocked any additional outfits in Ninja Gaiden 2 Black, you'll get one chance to switch costumes each level. When you see the title screen for each chapter, you can press either Y or Triangle to select your outfit.

You can also switch outfits during Tag missions. When you select your character at the start of the mission, look at the bottom of the loadout list. There you will see all the available outfits for that character.

item.title: 8 Best First-Person Horror Games You've Probably Never Heard Of
item.description:
Summary

  • The horror game market is oversaturated, leaving some unique and underappreciated gems unnoticed.
  • Games like Among the Sleep, Narcosis, and Visage offer new and intense experiences in horror gaming.
  • Some underrated horror games like Apsulov, Maid of Sker, and Cry of Fear deserve more attention for their unique settings and gameplay.

Horror games have always been a staple of the gaming world, but ever since the early 2010s, there has been a massive boom in horror game popularity, particularly in the indie world. While that's great for horror gamers, inevitably, some games get cast aside and never get the attention they deserve, particularly in the saturated first-person horror game market.

That doesn't mean that these games should be missed. In actuality, some of the most unique experiences in all of horror gaming come from underappreciated projects that need a little love. Whether it's playing as a toddler or exploring the bottom of the deep, dark ocean, there are a lot of great first-person horror games you've probably never heard of that are worth checking out.

8 Among The Sleep

Knee-High Horror

Among the Sleep
Survival Horror
Action-Adventure
Systems
Released
May 29, 2014

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

ESRB
m
Powered by

In the early 2010s, the horror game boom taught developers a lot, but maybe most importantly, it taught them that horror was a genre primed for experimentation and emotional storytelling. While there were certainly many Amnesia clones, there was also a slew of other projects that tried to take horror games in entirely new directions.

Among the Sleep is one of the very best experiments in this category. Instead of playing as a capable adult, the player controls a toddler. This genius move makes everything else feel scarier from a child's perspective, and the game delivers some incredibly memorable scares without a big budget.

7 Narcosis

What Lurks Below

6 Images
6 Images
Narcosis
8.0 /10
Released
March 28, 2017

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

ESRB
M For Mature: Blood and Gore, Language, Violence
Powered by

Unfortunately, getting attention as an indie developer during the horror boom of the 2010s was sometimes tricky. For every smash hit like Doki Doki Literature Club , there were hundreds of games that went unfairly unnoticed and unplayed.

Narcosis was one of those games that missed finding a big audience, which is a shame, because its deep-sea setting mixed with psychological horror and a hefty dose of arachnophobia is really punchy stuff. For players who loved games like SOMA or horror games set at sea, Narcosis is the next best thing.

6 Visage

The P.T. Successor

Visage
Horror
Systems
Released
October 30, 2020
ESRB
m
Developer(s)
SadSquare Studio

Powered by

The removal of P.T. from all game stores was a tragedy, particularly as the short playable demo is probably one of the greatest horror games ever made, which is saying something. Yet, the fallout of the Kojima/Konami fiasco and the subsequent cancellation of Silent Hills meant a follow-up was not forthcoming.

Luckily, there were plenty of indie developers willing to take up the mantle, and Visage is the best of the lot. With a strong focus on hyper-realistic graphics, visceral first-person scares, and brilliant lighting systems, Visage is the P.T. successor that gamers were clamoring for, one that's full of unsettling details for the keen-eyed gamer.

5 Cry Of Fear

An Underplayed Classic

Cry of Fear
8.0 /10
Released
February 22, 2012

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

ESRB
m
Powered by

Valve is a unique company for a lot of reasons, but it's truly remarkable how many mods and fan games based on their properties are spun into brilliant games all on their own, matching and even surpassing the efforts of AAA developers. While Garry's Mod and Counter-Strike get all the glory, horror gamers need to check out Cry of Fear .

Based on a mod for Half-Life , Cry of Fear is a psychologically intensive and viscerally terrifying romp through a nightmarish version of Stockholm full of creepy monsters and devilish horror set pieces. It's a rollicking good time with a lot to say about mental health, and is criminally underplayed.

4 Apsulov: End Of Gods

Odin Of The Future

6 Images
6 Images
Apsulov: End of Gods
Action
Adventure
Indie
Systems
Released
August 8, 2019

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

ESRB
M for Mature 17+ // Blood and Gore, Intense Violence, Strong Language
Powered by

For unclear reasons, the mid- to late-2010s, and even the early 2020s, saw a massive boom in popularity for Norse and Viking history, with a deluge of games and media taking inspiration from it dropping almost every week. Inevitably, some games would get lost in that flood, and unfortunately, Apsulov: End of Gods was one of them.

That's a shame, because Apsulov is actually unique in transposing Norse mythology, symbology, and imagery into a futuristic sci-fi horror setting, making it stand out from the crowd. Still, it never got the crowd it deserved, but for any fans of Norse-inspired games with a keen eye for folk horror, no game plays quite like Apsulov .

3 Maid Of Sker

The Welsh Get A Look In

Maid of Sker
Horror
Systems
Released
July 28, 2020

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
M For Mature 17+ Due to Blood and Gore, Strong Language, Violence
Powered by

Wales gets overlooked more often than it deserves. It's a country brimming with creative talent, yet it struggles to make a splash on the world stage. Wales Interactive, the developers behind Maid of Sker , made a conscious effort to change the conversation and let the gaming world take notice by setting all their games in Wales, often drawing on Welsh folklore.

While Maid of Sker may not have made the splash they were hoping for, it's still well worth playing, It's a great horror game with a unique setting (which is probably one of the best horror game hotels ever made), and makes for a great weekend game that doesn't take up too much time. Even with its short runtime, it sticks in the memory thanks to its effective sound-based scares and stunning graphical fidelity.

2 Clive Barker's Undying

Horror Fiction Makes The Jump

Clive Barker's Undying
9.0 /10
Released
February 7, 2021

WHERE TO PLAY

PHYSICAL

ESRB
m
Powered by

Horror book fans will know that Clive Barker is one of the greatest horror authors of all time. His books, and particularly his short stories, are gruesome little affairs that draw on grisly imagery and Lovecraftian elements to cement themselves in the canon of great horror literature.

However, Barker's success never fully translated into the world of video games. That said, Clive Barker's Undying , the most notable effort that was first released in 2001 as, ostensibly, a Doom clone, successfully translates what makes his novels great into a whole new medium. The game has a cult following, particularly for its unique story, which follows an Irish paranormal investigator, and its crunchy magic and gun-based gameplay.

1 Penumbra: Overture

The Amnesia Predecessor

Penumbra: Overture - Episode 1
Released
March 30, 2007

Platform(s)
PC
Powered by

Though its reputation has become somewhat mixed since its release, Amnesia: The Dark Descent is one of the most important horror games ever made, fundamentally shifting the style of horror games that came afterwards in a way that the gaming world still feels to this day. With that much attention, it's really surprising that Frictional Games' previous effort in the Penumbra series—three episodic horror games that take players deep within strange icy caverns, hidden facilities, and dread-filled caves—remains relatively unknown despite the developer's pedigree.

With each entry, it's easy to say Frictional honed their horror craft, delivering on much of what makes Amnesia: The Dark Descent work later on, including a really eerie atmosphere. The entire Penumbra series of games is criminally underplayed and underrated, so any horror fan looking for their next terrifying experience should take notice.

item.title: Clair Obscur Expedition 33 - Sinister Cave 100% Guide
item.description:
When it comes to exploring the Continent in Clair Obscur: Expedition 33 , there's always an ominous feeling about what you'll find in its deepest reaches and the furthest corners of the map. Sometimes they're small surprises; other times, they're entirely new locations that you may have otherwise overlooked in your travels.

One such location in Clair Obscur: Expedition 33 that dwells under the shadow of the Monolith is the Sinister Cave. If you're unfamiliar with this landmark and what it entails, here's a guide to walk you through all of its secrets and make sure you don't miss out on any treasures.

How to Find the Sinister Cave in Clair Obscur: Expedition 33

The Sinister Cave is an optional location that you can find about midway through Act 2 of the game's story, at the earliest. However, exploring this area is not recommended until your party is an average of Level 50 or higher, so prepare your gear and best weapons accordingly. Otherwise, you can save this location for your endgame exploration, at which point it will be far more manageable.

Sinister Cave is the sole landmark on a remote isle far east of Sirene island (as seen above). Once you arrive at this portion of the Continent as part of the storyline, it'll be easy to access, as you only need Esquie's swimming ability to reach it. The isle in question is covered in red trees, with not much else on it besides one random encounter with a Hexga and a couple of other Nevrons. When you're ready, interact with the Sinister Cave's main entrance.

How to Complete Sinister Cave in Clair Obscur Expedition 33

Once inside the Sinister Cave, feel free to save at the nearby Expedition Flag before moving forward. Make your way through the slightly claustrophobic tunnel ahead, where you can see a glowing item on a ledge to your right. Unfortunately, you can't reach it for now, so continue onward.

Upon reaching the main area ahead, you'll notice that it's unsettlingly dark everywhere, and you'll need to do your best to keep track of your steps while navigating the different routes. Also, make note of the Gestral Merchant on the raised platform (you can see its lantern) ahead, though you won't be able to reach them just yet.

Start by immediately taking the left path and follow it until it brings you to a small area with a collapsed, glowing Nevron (as seen above). Pick up the item in front of it to claim the Elerim weapon (Earth element) for Lune. Follow the path past the Nevron until it brings you to a fork. Go right, which will take you back to the entrance of the main area.

Now take the right path, which will eventually take you to a cliff face to grapple up to. (Ignore the lower path for now.) Do so, then look behind you to grapple across the gap, and follow the next path until it brings you seemingly to a dead end. Look for a hole in the ground just big enough for you to fall through. This will bring you down to the ledge where that unreachable item was. Pick it up to claim the Nocturne Pour Lumiere music record.

Make your way back to the main area once more, take the right path again, and grapple back up as you did before. Follow the same path until you see an opening to your right, before the dead end. Approach it carefully, and you should see the platform where the Merchant is standing below. Jump down and pick up the Corderon weapon (Dark element) for Sciel on the ground in front of it. If you interact with the Merchant, surprisingly nothing will happen as, it turns out, "it's dead."

Jump down from the platform and, once again, head right. This time, however, follow the lower path instead of the grapple jump. Keep running and around the corner will be your main adversary of this cave, the Chromatic Chalier . Engage it when you're ready to start a battle.

How to Beat The Chromatic Chalier

Like other Chromatic-tier Nevrons in the game, the Chromatic Chalier is essentially an enhanced version of the Chalier nevron (such as the one you find at the Floating Cemetery). Thus, its attacks will be more powerful and relentless. It is easy to approach, however, so make sure to get your First Strike bonus to start the battle on your terms.

This is especially important because this boss immediately starts with the Berserk status effect active, allowing it to buff its attack power by 5% each turn it gets. Its attacks are primarily melee combos for you to dodge and/or parry, so do your best to get as many counterattacks in as possible (remember to equip certain Pictos to buff your counterattack damage significantly!) while avoiding the brunt of its damage. Otherwise, this fight is quite straightforward.

The Chromatic Chalier does boast a hefty health bar, so make sure to have your best, most powerful skills equipped for each party member. Pile on Burn stacks when possible, especially with Lune and Maelle's fire-elemental skills. Focus on filling the boss's break gauge, which, when "broken," will lower their defense significantly and stun them for a brief period, allowing you to get an extra turn or so in before they can retaliate.

Once defeated, the Chromatic Chalier will drop the Chalium weapon (Light element) for Maelle, along with a Resplendent Chroma Catalyst (Grandiose if you're on NG+), and 5x Colour of Lumina.

10 Images
10 Images

item.title: One Disney Dreamlight Valley Addition Could Complete a Dynamic Duo
item.description:
Since its early access days, Disney Dreamlight Valley has remained committed to propping up films from Walt Disney Animation and Pixar Studios. This is most obvious in the hit simulation game’s character roster, which only features iconic characters from the aforementioned studios. However, Disney obviously has a huge array of profitable IPs under its umbrellas. Slowly, Disney Dreamlight Valley has begun to incorporate these cash cow properties, mostly in the game’s motifs, furniture, clothing, and various other design items. While it doesn’t seem as though these non-Walt Disney Animation and Pixar Studios properties will head to Disney Dreamlight Valley ’s character roster anytime soon, the game has managed to add full-fledged characters outside these companies to the game without including them on its character roster.

Disney Dreamlight Valley manages to sneak these characters into the game as Companions. Technically, only one character outside of Walt Disney Animation and Pixar Studios has officially received Companion status, but it sets a precedent for future additions. However, R2-D2’s addition to Disney Dreamlight Valley as a Companion would not have been possible without various animal sidekicks from Disney films getting the same treatment as well, like Pegasus from Hercules , Pua from the Moana franchise, the Footstool from Beauty and the Beast , and Minnie Mouse’s cat Figaro.

R2-D2 Has Joined Disney Dreamlight Valley

But R2-D2 simply can’t be left in Disney Dreamlight Valley to his own devices. Sure, R2-D2 was not the only piece of Star Wars content that joined the hit simulation game. In addition to the lovable droid, a Naboo-inspired House Dream Style and accompanying furniture, clothing inspired by Padme Amidala, a set of Jedi Robes, a lightsaber hand accessory with accompanying photo pose, and various other Star Wars items joined the game in celebration of May 4.

These new items are certainly fun for players while also being a profitable move for Disney Dreamlight Valley . Yet R2-D2 is often depicted as a duo with another iconic Star Wars droid. Perhaps this was a strategic move by Disney and Gameloft, leaving more Star Wars content by the wayside to be added to Disney Dreamlight Valley next year if this initial release was successful. With player reception to the new Star Wars content mostly positive, R2-D2 should definitely be joined by his buddy C3PO in Disney Dreamlight Valley .

How C3PO Could Head to Disney Dreamlight Valley

However, adding C3PO to Disney Dreamlight Valley may be a bit more difficult than R2-D2’s addition. Unlike R2-D2, C3PO is very humanoid, walking around on two legs. This is much different from other Companions already present in Disney Dreamlight Valley , which tend to be animals and objects that roll, crawl, fly, or walk on four legs. Therefore, C3PO may have to break Disney Dreamlight Valley tradition entirely, and either become one of the first bipedal Companions or one of the game’s first full-fledged Star Wars characters.

The first option would be ideal, as while the new Star Wars items were well-received by Disney Dreamlight Valley ’s playerbase, the simulation game should focus on Walt Disney Animation and Pixar Studios. Disney Dreamlight Valley ’s Villagers similarly follow players across the Valley in the same manner as Companions, though this only occurs if Villager-specific quests are in progress. In comparison, Companions are enabled as a clothing item. Making C3PO a Companion could be a way for Disney Dreamlight Valley to yet again test the limits of its playerbase, determining if it has become more receptive to the addition of Star Wars characters. Of course, Disney Dreamlight Valley may go a new route entirely for C3PO, perhaps making the droid an exclusive NPC or an interactive piece of furniture. Nevertheless, R2-D2 and C3PO deserve to be reunited in Disney Dreamlight Valley .

item.title: Marvel Rivals Fan Shows Off One Piece Skin Concepts
item.description:
Summary

  • A Marvel Rivals fan shows off their impressive designs for a series of crossover skins inspired by beloved anime franchise One Piece.
  • The series of artwork features new skins for Mister Fantastic as Monkey D. Luffy, Human Torch as Portgas D. Ace, and Rocket Raccoon as Tony Tony Chopper.
  • The Marvel Rivals crossover ideas saw plenty of praise from fans of the game, expressing their desire for new crossover skins within the popular hero shooter.

A Marvel Rivals fan is sharing their stunning concepts for a new set of skins based on One Piece , with Mister Fantastic, Human Torch, and Rocket Raccoon sporting new looks. The online hero shooter featuring some of Marvel's most iconic characters was a smash hit following its release late last year, boasting hundreds of thousands of active players. Marvel Rivals has seen frequent updates since its launch, with multiple new Heroes added to the game during each of its two competitive seasons. Now, one fan is imagining a pair of anime-inspired skins for three popular characters.

Following the release of the Season 1 update in January, the game added one of the comic book juggernaut's most iconic groups to Marvel Rivals ' playable roster. The Fantastic Four would see their in-game debuts staggered throughout the first season, with Mister Fantastic and Invisible Woman launching during the first half of Season 1 and Human Torch and Thing in the second half. The four characters would quickly become popular picks in the game following their release, with multiple considered to be "S-tier" characters. A fan is now giving the group's two Duelists and another roster member a One Piece -inspired makeover.

Reddit user oongelica showed off their stunning designs for One Piece -themed skins on the official Marvel Rivals subreddit. The impressive art shows off a new design for an alternate outfit for Mister Fantastic based on One Piece protagonist Monkey D. Luffy, complete with Luffy's iconic straw hat. Human Torch features a new design inspired by one of One Piece 's most beloved supporting cast members in Portgas D. Ace. The depiction of Mister Fantastic as Luffy also features Rocket Raccoon donning a new outfit based on Tony Tony Chopper.

Marvel Rivals Fan Designs One Piece Crossover Skins

The crossover skins for Marvel Rivals saw plenty of praise from fans, both for the impressive art and the fitting character selection. Many fans loved the choice of Mister Fantastic to receive a Luffy skin, with each character featuring similar abilities to stretch their limbs for powerful attacks. Some voiced their desire for NetEase to add official crossover skins to Marvel Rivals , suggesting that they would "open their wallet" at the opportunity to pick up crossover skins. One fan even stated they would "instantly main Mister Fantastic" if he received a Luffy skin.

The fan's unique idea for crossover skins comes as Marvel Rivals looks to have a particularly exciting update on the way later this week. Friday will welcome the game's "Season 2.5" update marking the halfway point of the second competitive season, introducing a new map with the addition of Arakko. The patch is also set to bring the release of Marvel Rivals ' newest playable Hero, with Ultron debuting as a powerful new Strategist character. Marvel Rivals has lots in store for fans as the game gears up for the second half of Season 2.
